title: Copyright Term Basics
description: Information about copyright terms and public domain entry

content.text: Most countries follow the 'life + 70 years' rule, meaning copyright protection lasts for the author's lifetime plus 70 years after their death.
Copyright terms vary globally: some countries use 'life + 50 years', others use 'life + 80 years', and a few use 'life + 100 years'. Always check the specific jurisdiction.
For anonymous works, corporate authorship, and some other categories, copyright terms may be calculated from the date of publication rather than the author's death.

Works enter public domain on January 1st of the year following the expiration of their copyright term. For example, a work with 'life + 70' protection enters PD on January 1st of the 71st year after the author's death.
